City Council

Overview

The Seguin City Council is comprised of a Mayor and eight City Council Members. Council members are elected from the district in which they reside, with the exception of the mayor who is elected at large. Council members and the mayor are elected to serve four-year terms, with a maximum limit of 2 terms. In the absence of the mayor, the mayor pro tem presides over council meetings. District 1 Council Member Joe Rea currently serves as Mayor Pro-Tem.

City Council is responsible for approving an annual operating budget, setting the tax rate, adopting all city ordinances, planning for capital improvements, as well as appointing a City Manager that serves as chief executive to oversee day-to-day municipal operations. 

Council agendas are posted on this website and on the bulletin board at City Hall at least 72 hours prior to meetings, as required by the Texas Open Meetings Act.

Meetings

  • Meetings are held on the first and third Tuesday of the month, with work sessions scheduled as needed
  • 5:30 pm
  • Seguin City Hall - Council Chambers
    210 E. Gonzales Street
    Seguin, Texas 78155

Meetings are broadcast via a Livestream and videos are available online.

Not sure which district you are in? Use the City Services GIS Application and search by address to find your district and council representative or view the Check your district (PDF).
